alert.note: Alert for Independence; Jackson (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 6:52PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Independence and southeastern Jackson Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 652 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Oil Trough, or 10 miles west of Newport, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newport... Tuckerman... Diaz... Newark... Grubbs... Oil Trough... Jacksonport... Algoa... McFadden... Campbell Station... Beedeville... Amagon... Weldon... Balch... Blackville... Olyphant... Shoffner... Thida... Ingleside... Stegall... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for eastern and north central Arkansas.
